section.title: Proofreader Tools

figure.alt: Screenshot of bug/typo report tool in action

section.p: NVList comes with an optional bug/typo reporting mode specifically made for proofreaders and beta testers. To activate this special mode, turn on enableProofreaderTools from within Build.jar and do a rebuild. This adds a conspicuous yellow button to the menu bar which, when pressed, opens a popup window where the user can enter a comment. The entered comment is appended to some automatically collected information (current Lua stack trace, visible text, etc.) and added to save/bugreport.log.
This systems allows proofreaders to supply comments in the most efficient way possible, while simultaneously collecting considerably more detailed information of the bug/typo location in the script.

section.title: Crash Reports
section.p: When an exception is raised inside engine code, an error dialogue pops up giving the user the opportunity to report/ignore the error or quit the program. The default behavior of the error report function is to gather the error logs in a .zip and save the file somewhere on the user's machine. If you have a webserver, it's also possible to make the report button POST the generated .zip directly to an URL of your choosing â€” just change the value of the errorReportURL preference.
